alert.note: Alert for Noxubee (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 01 at 10:18AM CST until March 03 at 8:40PM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Mississippi... Noxubee River At Macon affecting Noxubee County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Mississippi... Pearl River Above Philadelphia affecting Neshoba County. Big Black River At West affecting Holmes and Attala Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Noxubee River At Macon. * WHEN...Until Thursday evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CST Tuesday the stage was 29.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM CST Tuesday was 30.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 29.2 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 26.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 29.2 feet on 12/11/2004. && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Noxubee River Macon 26.0 29.0 Tue 10 am CS 28.1 24.5 21.6 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=JAN The next statement will be issued this evening at 1015 PM CST.
